greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n as an ordered sum of 8 squares of positive integers.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 8..20000
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
formula: G.f.: (theta_3(x) - 1)^8 / 256, where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function.
mathematica: nmax = 64; CoefficientList[Series[(EllipticTheta[3, 0, x] - 1)^8/256, {x, 0, nmax}], x] // Drop[#, 8] &
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 31 2021
